Velocity.misconception: Velocity and speed are the same
Velocity.correction: Speed has only magnitude, while velocity has both magnitude and direction.

Velocity.misconception: Negative velocity means the object is slowing down
Velocity.correction: Negative velocity indicates direction, not reduction in speed.

Acceleration.misconception: Acceleration only means increase in speed
Acceleration.correction: Acceleration is change in velocity, which can involve change in speed, direction, or both.

Distance.misconception: Distance and displacement are always equal
Distance.correction: Distance is total path length, while displacement is the shortest straight-line distance.
